name: The Butterfly Effect
description: A temporary art installation co-curated with young people, exploring extinction, climate change, and hope for the future.
location: Sedgwick Museum of Earth Sciences, Downing Street, Cambridge, CB2 3EQ

name: Breaking New Ground: Celebrating Past, Present and Future Women Earth Scientists at the University of Cambridge
description: A display celebrating women Earth scientists, co-curated by Earth Sciences students.
location: Sedgwick Museum of Earth Sciences, Downing Street, Cambridge, CB2 3EQ

name: Glenn Ligon: All Over The Place
description: An exhibition showcasing the work of American contemporary artist Glenn Ligon.
location: The Fitzwilliam Museum, Trumpington Street, Cambridge, CB2 1RB

name: New Display ‘+FRANKLIN: Rosalind Franklin and DNA’
description: Discover the blue plaque repeatedly graffitied to acknowledge Rosalind Franklin’s contribution to the history of DNA.
location: Whipple Museum of the History of Science, Free School Lane, Cambridge, CB2 3RH

name: Chamber Music Concerts - Subscription Ticket
description: A series of fifteen Chamber Music concerts over the year.
location: Kettle's Yard, Castle Street, Cambridge, CB3 0AQ
booking_details: £240 (£75 students). Subscription tickets available for collection at the first concert attended.

name: The Cavendish Laboratory and the Birth of the Atomic Age
description: A new exhibition exploring the history of the Cavendish Laboratory and its role in the birth of the atomic age.
location: Whipple Museum of the History of Science, Free School Lane, Cambridge, CB2 3RH

name: Picturing Excess: Jan Davidsz de Heem
description: Experience monumental still-life paintings by Dutch artist Jan Davidsz de Heem, displayed together for the first time.
location: The Fitzwilliam Museum, Trumpington Street, Cambridge, CB2 1RB

name: Fault Lines: Imagining Indigenous futures for colonial collections
description: An exhibition exploring interactions between Indigenous communities of the volcanic Pacific region and colonial institutions.
location: Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Downing Street, Cambridge, CB2 3DZ

name: Snowdrop Trail 2025
description: Explore the beauty of snowdrops across the Garden with our self-guided trail.
location: Cambridge University Botanic Garden, 1 Brookside, Cambridge, CB2 1JE
booking_details: Free with normal Garden admission. Drop-in, no booking required.
